Reviews.Title: “Certainly will not come back here.”
Reviews.Author: susanpradja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to accompany my husband on his business trip (his office is in Asia part). We supposed to stay 3 nights with corporate rate (Sunday to Wednesday) but we decided to add one more night from Saturday which I booked from booking.com for EUR 90.88 weekend rate. Location, like others said, it's very far from historic areas (Sultanahmet). It cost us 90 Lira (EUR 40) by taxi at night to get here from the Ataturk airport. When we arrived, we informed the reception staff that we would stay until Wednesday but he said that the corporate rate (EUR 144/night included breakfast) is only for 1 person and we have to pay EUR 30 extra per night for 2 occupancy. Usually 5 star hotels will never charge you extra for double occupancy, as long as only 1 person who get the breakfast (we used to stay at Hyatt) but he insisted that we have to pay whether I take the breakfast or not. The next morning, we decided to cancel the remaining stays since we thought it's not worth to pay additional EUR 90 in total and I still have to pay for the taxi to the historic parts everyday because there is no other transportation, not even a shuttle from the hotel to the nearest metro bus station. And with the awful traffic in Istanbul, I don't think I could stand it. We finally move to other hotel in Sultanahmet area and we glad we did it! One more thing, my husband left his IPhone charger in the room when we check out, and the next day he came back to the hotel and asked about this, but they could not find it. The staffs are not helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great experiece”
Reviews.Author: Alin_Ionescu
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a very good experience. The rooms are large, clean and if you stay at a higher level you also have a good view. The hotel is located in the Asian part of the city and if you have to go the European part of the city this will take some while. The restaurant is good, we had good experiences for breakfasts and dinner. The staff was very friendly and I had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but a little distant from sites”
Reviews.Author: Steven B
Reviews.Content: 4/5 star hotel/rooms/service slightly let down by the location - 15 minute taxi ride from the Harem ferry boat. The advantage, however, was the pleasure of the ferry crossing (remarkably rapid and efficient) and the morning view on the way to the Old City and the nightime scene on the return to the hotel. Nothing of a tourist interest anywhere near the hotel, but Bagdat Avenue (which runs for miles along the southern shore) looked like a fantastic shopping area with a great evening buzz.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel if you do business somewhere near”
Reviews.Author: tattuck
Reviews.Content: Let's face it - from touristic perspective this hotel is in the middle of nowhere. But if you do business on Asian side you'll be happy with it. It has decent rooms, great spa and wellness center. Breakfast is also pretty good. I'd stay there again (already did several times) and would recommend it to anyone looking for a place in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Good !”
Reviews.Author: Effem83
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the executive room. Quite a good experience. Location is a bit iffy from where we needed to be but the taxi service was quite prompt. Helpful staff and a good restaurant. I was there in October 2010

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave_one1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a number of times in Jan & Feb 2012. A good hotel without being spectacular. The usual amenities. Everything seems to work as it should. The staff are helpful & knowledgeable. And understand the challenges of being a foreigner in Istanbul. If you are traveling from the airport in peak hour it can take 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: Katja427
Reviews.Content: Good service, nice rooms. Somewhat expensive (beer or glass of wine around 7 euros). Nice swimming pool, remeber to bring your swimming cap, otherwise you have to pay for one. Wines listed in room service menu didnt exist, so ended up with more expensive one than originally thought. Not for tourist due to long distance to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: doogo
Reviews.Content: Great service levels, lovely rooms, excellent food - location close to business if not close to any of the tourist sites in Istanbul. Would recommend highly to any business traveller with meetings at locations on Asian side of Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: divyagarwal
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, with the standard amenities provided by other hotels in this category. Nothing out of the ordinary. The staff is nice and courteous, the food is good. The breakfast spread is great. I do wish that Internet was freely available throughout the hotel. The internet was so expensive (EUR 22 for a day), with frequent disconnections. I chose to upgrade on my second day to the executive room (EUR 75 extra per day), but here I was getting additional benefits such as use of the lounge, and free minibar and food in the lounge, that made up for the excess charges. The view from the executive lounge balcony is excellent. Cons: The hotel is not really close to any touristy things one might want to do, and the only shopping centre 'Palladium' is also not within walking distance. Pros: Service, and the welcome sweets at the reception!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Gauravramchandani
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable, well decorated and have the right amenities. The hotel staff has been trained very well, service was fair. The restaurant was very good including the food. Over all this hotel is nice and comfortable and welcoming. I would surely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: 3tonkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days before moving on to Bodrum for a "blue cruise". The rooms are very nice..upscale Marriott style. The outside dining area is stunning, and the breakfast fare amazing. I can't say about the other meals or room service. Concierge, doorman, all exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Business in Anatolyan side of the city”
Reviews.Author: Avargasil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the rooms are comfortable, I didn't like the spa too much, its only OK. Service was fair. The restaurant was very good and service was excellent. But the hotel is far from Istanbul heart, out of the Palladium Mall there is little to do around. I take it because I had meetings close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and top services”
Reviews.Author: luismparis
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is a top choice for the business traveler. The rooms are comfortable, well decorated and have the right amenities. The hotel staff has been trained very well. They can capture fast and effectively every need from the business traveler; and they deliver with a smile. This is a role model that other hotels catering the business traveler should emulate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel far from city”
Reviews.Author: khoeiny
Reviews.Content: Most of Marriott hotels have a similar stylish and facilities , if you are going to Istanbul and you want to have sometimes in city , you should forget this hotel , no taxi knows the address , and if he knows it takes arround 45 minutes from city center , this hotel is suitable for a business trip for the area near the hotel. The room is clean enough and full of lights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - lives up to the Marriott Brand”
Reviews.Author: ccozens
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights here on business. The hotel is as would be expected of the Marriott. Club Lounge nice, with a roof terrace with far reaching views. Only issue is the remote nature of the hotel for eating out. Not really within easy walking distance of places being surrounded by busy roads - Taxis are easy to get and cheap. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Istanbul's Asian side”
Reviews.Author: murjika
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best 5 star hotels I've stayed in. Truly meeting the expectations that Marriott brand name raises in your mind.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel not so good location”
Reviews.Author: rommel21
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 days in Marriott Asia, which is a very nice hotel in the Asian side of Istanbul. The room is very spacious and luxury, the bar and the restaurant is very nice and the personnel is very friendly. For the price I booked <200â‚¬/night it was more than I could expect. Of course the location is not so good and you need a taxi to go move to sightseeing areas. Also in order to get here from the airport, you must cross the bridge which is usually very difficult because of traffic (more than 1 hour). So the conclusion is that, if your 'business' is from the Asian side you must select this hotel for your stay, if not go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property & lovely people”
Reviews.Author: kittycat2011
Reviews.Content: A wonderful experience thanks to Mr Barbaros Sarsilmaz & Mr Semih - the duty managers of this hotel during my stay. Thankyou so much to the both of you for making our stay comfortable and a pleasure and helping me out so much. Ours was a crazy whirlwhind last minute booking of a huge group including a celebrity. The service these guys gave us and assistance to me personally will go down in my history of best hotel experiences. They were there any time for whatever requirements we had and made sure that we were completely taken care of given our crazy 20 hour days. I had sone hare-brained passport losing and then some cash losing moments and these guys found it all for me and kept everything at peace with my group! I had a wee bit of a problem with one of these younger sales girls who was quite dumb and kept pestering me wasting my international call time but she was new and excited i guess! The breakfast is AWESOME! What a spread. The indoors & outdoors meets beautifully and makes it a really nice morning. The restaurants too serve nice food and the service is good. I went for a Hammam the traditional way and was not disappointed. The spa is really nice ( a tad expensive) and well appointed and the treatment was really good! I wish there was free wi-fi in the lobby but they do have half hour slips for free.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful property and service but no free wifi in lobby or public areas”
Reviews.Author: kruh
Reviews.Content: Wonderful property and service but no free wifi in lobby or public areas! I dined in Orange grill for breakfast .Food and staff was impeccable. Location is little though if you are gonna spend your time in European side of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a So-So Location”
Reviews.Author: lyon4uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights on business in Oct. 2011 and used the fitness/spa facilities, Orange Grill, and conference facilities. All were very good. The fitness centre is open 24 hrs and the indoor pool is available for early lengths. Rooms were comfortable and well-appointed. The Orange Grill breakfast/lunch buffet is excellent although no omelet station. The F&B/conference staff were superb and the 'Citrus' conference room is excellent. OK, a few annoyances. Number 1, no free WiFi; not even in the lobby. Today, this is just not acceptable and the usage charges were quite costly. Number 2, location. There is a Carrefour and a few street shops nearby but hardly what you'd call a good walk-about neighbourhood. Istanbul traffic is brutal at most times and this hotel can be a 2 hr+ slog from the airport. If business is your pleasure, this could be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place indeed !”
Reviews.Author: Maniac77
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. The reason it does not qualify for my 5 stars is the rates for internet and other add on features. They need to relax them a little. Otherwise an excellent place, great service and nice friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “ARROGANT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: tavishi
Reviews.Content: Istanbul Marriott Hotel Asia-ARROGANT STAFF Date : 25 Aug 2011 We lived in this Hotel during my conference from 13 to 15 Aug 2011 with my family.On the second day of stay as we reach our room after breakfast,Room did not open from keycards swipe inspite of repeated efforts,then we contacted AT YOUR SERVICE from lobby phone to change the cards or let know the reason of keycards not working. We waited there for more than 30 mins but no body from AT YOUR SERVICE not contacted us or attended room for problem resolution nor told any thing to us. After that I gone to Recption to change room keycards,the person available arrogantly spoken to me and told that as we have used internet/TV so that they have blocked our access to room and first I have to pay euro 10 for use of internet when I told him that we have very tight schedule and not any time to use internet,Children with us have opened TV only, and for just payment of euro 10 you have blocked access without informing us to made payment. He did not understand my logic and look very arrogantly, I immadiately made payment. But this is very bad experience,I have travelled at different locations across the globe but never received such treatment or staff behaviour. I will not recommend to stay there. VIPIN KUMAR INDIA

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: h0lidays_fr0m_hell_
Reviews.Content: Accompanied my husband while he was working there, it was a lovely room with a good view, quality bathroom, I used the gym and swimming pool it was nice and clean with polite unobtrusive staff, I would have possibly used the beauty rooms if I had had been able to read what the treatments were in English , Breakfast was nice enough, would prefer not to have to make my own toast in a 5 star hotel , the room was quiet, we didn't hear anything from above or below. Just over the road is a Carrefour supermarket and a small shopping mall which I found useful for buying gifts. It's a few minutes walk from the hotel, there is a large shopping mall with various shops and restaurants called the palladium which is close by but impossible to walk to and only a few mins in a taxi. I would recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “water & internet are not free !”
Reviews.Author: Z000Z
Reviews.Content: it was very disappointing to me when i found that i had to pay for using internet connection and for drink water in a five stars hotel Deluxe Room when staying in while it's free in many 3 stars hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great corner suite, but far from Sultanahmet area”
Reviews.Author: AussieNarelle
Reviews.Content: Was only in town for two nights and the business need was on the Asia side. Great room - book a corner room if you can - great circular bath overlooking the city. Club floor was good, but smallish facilities. Nice that the minibar was free if staying on the club floor...hate getting the munchies working late at night and not wanting to pay the high minibar prices. Meal in the hotel was okay. Long drive to and from the airport, but always enjoy the car ferry going from the Asia side to the European side. Would stay there again if have a business need to be on the Asia side.

Reviews.Title: “â€œloved the hote but checking in was a hassleâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Smith23w
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful there, the ambiance was relaxing but when we were checking in (around 1:00 pm), the front desk people are rude, and slow check in ... I have to say that this place is good for business traveler . And please get new people for front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: TnSuits
Reviews.Content: If you're up for dropping some cash on a nice retreat from tourist-central, this is the place. Walk across the street to a shopping center (with a Marriott card, they'll let you in the back door even!) for easy dinner/quick needs. Beautiful rooms, 3 swimming pools (only heated indoors), including kiddie pools, spa looks AMAZING but again - PRICEY. Breakfast is PHENOMENAL - couldn't dream of what else they could offer. Completely ridiculous that a hotel of this caliber doesn't offer free Wireless internet - only available to Executive rooms!! This was a big negative for us, as we weren't interested in the extra 75 Euro/night for an upgrade!! Pillows were awful. Neck still hurting. The "adjoining" rooms were great for a family - have your own door to a mini-hallway that the rooms connect from. Put the kids to bed at night in one room, hung out in the other room as adults - great setup for us.

Reviews.Title: “Superb modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzieWinston
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, stayed on business so didn't get to enjoy the amazing facilities, would love to go back again for some holiday time there, exceptional service and standards, great location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent For Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: KnCliverpool
Reviews.Content: although quite a trek from Attaturk Airport, the hotel itself is impressive. Exec rooms, have the use of the lounge, with as is the norm snacks and drinks available, mini bar free and stocked daily in these rooms also. Free interent and breakfast served in the lounge on 22nd floor. Rooms spacious and clean. Bathroom spotless. all you should expect in the exec rooms. Restaurant: food and service extremely good. Check out: Fast and efficient. Airport transfers: approx 80 Euro plus tax, maybe a touch expensive, but cars well maintained unlike some of the cabs available at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with polite staff, internet for a fee, very limited cable channels”
Reviews.Author: sweety0310
Reviews.Content: Very courteous staff, allowed us to check-in earlier hassle-free. Slept soundly on their soft bed and pillows. Great breakfast selection. Internet is not included in the rate, cable channels are very limited....most english channels are pay per view.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Shawnnz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Istanbul Marriott Hotel Asia for three nights. Everything was perfect except traffic. I didn;t realize why many friends recommend to stay in European side of Istanbul. One Every day, we had to spend four hours for the trip.For the tour, big disadvantage at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Marriott Hotel - just what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Right-O
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times and it's a lovely hotel. I was on business travel so it was close to the office and therefore convenient. If I was a tourist, it would not really be the right place - better to stay on the European side. But as a business traveller, I would recommend this hotel if your work is nearby. Excellent, friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast buffet has plenty of delicious options and I was never disappointed. Beds are soft and comfortable. Rooms clean - everything fresh and new. If I have business near this area again, I will no doubt choose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for Business Trips”
Reviews.Author: ameirah
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the ideal location for my business trip, since my meetings were on the Asia side of Istanbul. If you are going for sightseeing however, please try to stay on the other side, since it was a hassle getting to the Europe side for some sightseeing because of bad traffic. There is one mall, Platinum mall I think, that is right next to the hotel, if you have no time and want a quick run through. It has no souvenir shops though if you plan on getting some, just wait until the airport. Food was exceptionally good, and honestly, I had lost faith in all Marriott's after a horrible stay in Marriot Zamalek, in Cairo Egypt, but luckily this one made me change my mind. Staff more than helpful. One down side, was that there were no English TV channels, and for network channels like Orbit or Showtime, etc... it was Pay per View.

Reviews.Title: “Very Attentive and professional service”
Reviews.Author: IngoMetzer
Reviews.Content: We (family with 1 seven year old son) had the chance to stay at the Istanbul Marriott Asia Hotel during the Bayram holidays in Turkey. We were very satisfied with the professionalism and friendly attitude of the whole staff. Rooms were equipped with everything necessary, very clean and functional, in all restaurants our child was treated very attentive and in a friendly manner. As a result. we can recommend the Istanbul Marriott Hotel Asia not only for business travelers but also to spend some relaxing days during holidays.

Reviews.Title: “One of my worst hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: WoDo12
Reviews.Content: Was on a business trip with colleagues and we had planned to stay in this hotel for a week as it is close to the office. The room rate was not bad but all extras seem to be excessive, e.g. Internet. Even choosing music from the entertainment system to listen to would cost 10 Euros.....but the worst was still to come: Ordered room service. The meal was delivered promptly. Then I opened the little ketchup glass that came with it only to find that it was full of cigarette butts (see photo attached). I almost threw up. The staff was somehow apologetic afterwards, but trust was lost in this hotel and we left at the earliest possibility.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a King”
Reviews.Author: DrZeek
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility! Big rooms, place is like brand new, spacious. Stayed 3 days and never left the building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable Marriott, with an excellent staff & restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CaptErnie
Reviews.Content: A very nice Marriott in a central location on the Asia side of Istanbul. Newer mid-sized shopping mall within a long walking distance. Staff very helpful with everything especially the lovely concierge ladies. One has to take taxis to the ferries, moderate prices. The hotel restaurant was above average with excellent food at reasonable prices. Only negative comment is that we went through 4 sets of hotel keys in 2 days before the electronic door lock would consistently work. The expensive internet would run 2 laptops(slowly), one on cable & one on wifi. Nothing to do with the hotel, but provide plenty of time to get anywhere around Istanbul. The road traffic is reaching gridlock, very slow going anywhere..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - and probably the only international far on the Asian side of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Munich_guy
Reviews.Content: Was there for business - prime reason to stay there was that it is close to our office. As quick summary - very nice rooms - a great view towards the sea and the princes islands as well as decent food from the business lounge on 22nd floor - worthwhile the extra rate - also includes fast internet access, and an excellent health club to add ... On the other side, for someone going to Istanbul for pleasure, be aware that it is quite far out to the East - approx. 20km from city centre, with heavy traffic jams towards downtown in the morning - not a problem for me - but for tourists going after the sights it would be .... If you were to consider staying at the hotel, consider checking out the IDO ferry service from Bostanci (20-30mins by taxi to get to the harbour) to the city (takes 30 mins from Bostanci to Kabatas) as well as have a day-trip to the princes islands as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: vivetsandys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 small children to escape the Istanbul heat for 3 wonderful nights. The facilities were great and we loved the giant outdoor pools. We lived at the pools during the day and they are top notch, though there is no visible lifeguard. The breakfast buffet is fantastic with a number of Turksih dishes as well as your more American items as well. Room service was prompt and delicious. The hotel itself is not located near any of the tourist spots so if you are looking to use it as a homebase for that I'm not sure it is your best option. The thing we will always remember is the amazing experience at check out. Our oldest turned 3 the day we were checking out and about 20 of the hotel staff threw him a small surprise birthday party in the lobby, singing Happy Birthday to him several times and cheering him on as he blew out the candles. I don't have enough kind words to say about the experience and we are already tyring to figure out how we can spend our son's next birthday there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Turkish Hospitality at its best!!”
Reviews.Author: ReikiRN
Reviews.Content: Very Nicely decorated, great food, and great service. Close to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities good, service very variable”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Thailand
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in July, on a business trip. The location was perfect for us, as it is close to our office. However, if you're staying as a tourist, you will be spending time in taxis &/or ferries I think if you want to see the sights on the European side. The front desk is ... not good. They are slow and bureaucratic. Not bad by most standards, just slow. It was quite usual to see 2 - 3 guests at the desk, with one or possibly two staff members working ... slowly. The facilities are good. Comfortable beds, good TV, good bathroom, good shower and WiFi. The bar serves a good snack and drinks are good. Breakfast is ok, not great. The selection is good and cappuccino is available if you ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel, but not very central”
Reviews.Author: DBrody
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and was not disappointed. The rooms are large, clean and modern, and very comfortable. The hotel has 3 fantastic pools, a good sized gym, and attentive staff. The restaurant is lovely and not as expensive as you would expect for a hotel like this. The buffet breakfast in particular was brilliant, with a huge selection of fresh and delicious food. It was a lovely hotel to spend a few days relaxing by the pool, but if you want to explore Istanbul's sights then it is a bit out of the way. But the internet is not free and is actually quite extortionate!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: sequinOxfordUK
Reviews.Content: A spacious hotel with good facilities and well staffed by helpful and attentive young staff. Tasty food in the restaurant both Turkish and international. Gym and spa very clean, well eqippped and popular. 3 swimming pools to suit guests. Well organised conference facilities and internet. Executive rooms were very well appointed and comfortable. Hotel is out of the city centre but there is a constant supply of taxis to take you to ferry or directly to teh older parts of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in Asian Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: pegasustr
Reviews.Content: Since 2007, its openning, I am staying there. I was also visiting some other options in Asian side of Istanbul. The quality of service, rooms, pools, Spa and breakfast are uncomperablely superior. It is located close to highway but due trafic it is a bit problematic if your targets (shopping, working etc) in Asian side, it is lovely. There are pretty close optimum outlet shopping mall (1-2 minutes per taxi) or Paladium (1 minute per taxi) both of them offers quite many dinner options. However, it is not easy to walk due the highways. Rooms typical marriott standard room, new, high quality. good working air condition, executive area (if you are gold member or pay 60â‚¬ extra) is also lovely with a good view of Istanbul's islands. Food there is also more than typical snack and could easily substitute lunch or dinner. SPA and swimming pools are also quite good and one of the most expensive in Istanbul. Outdoor swimming pool is a bit windy but acceptable. the only disadvantage is the price that is higher than any other competitors Byhotel few 100 meters only.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best Marriott (that I know of) in the World!”
Reviews.Author: HPM1984
Reviews.Content: Visiting in Istanbul on business- three nights at the Hotel Orient Express in Old town and then we switched on Monday night to the Istanul Marriott Hotel Asia for business meetings. I must admit I was prepared for a let down- the typical "I could be anywhere Marriot vanilla hotel in place from Key West to Athens"- but I was surprised, pleasantly, and continue to be surprised. I write the Title having stayed in Marriots in almost every US state, Tokyo, London, Germany, Amsterdam and Greece (and probably other Marriotts that my brain cells cannot summon). So what makes it special? Well the location is about a 10 minute (maybe 15 minute) ride from the Water Taxis that will take you straight to old town docking just in front of the "New" (new for 1700 that is) Mosque. So it is very convenient to Old and New Town. Second the facility itself- I thought it was new (maybe 6 months old) but it is three years old- but the housekeeping and maintenance (I assume) are so good that it appears as if it opened a few months prior. Rooms- are spacious (for Turkey or Europe) desks and sitting areas comfortable. Executive lounge is the best- with Asian Views two or three klicks away from the Bosphorus. Room are ultra quite- Marriott put a lot of thought into how they are arranged on a floor and the materials are absolutely soundproof! Staff is eager, and I mean eager to please. Had to send my laundry out (two week trip- one of those kind of trips) and the laundry returned the same night, beautifully packaged in a basket and on top was an envelope containing the 60 liras I had left stuffed on one or more of my pockets. Restaurant and Bar are beautiful - service for breakfast excellent. One lunch and it was super (so far). Health Club is co-sponsored by Johns Hopkins- state of the art- better than the club I belong to in the states- with trainers, kids programs (also a kids program if you are eating dinner I failed to mention) and every Pilate, Yoga, Stretching class, course you could imagine. Pool beautifully done with the bottom of the pool tiled in different shades of blue representing a crescent shape. Lobby excellent for meetings- conference rooms large and modern. What can I say for 175 euros (thank you Marriott for my Gold Upgrade to the Executive Level) it is the bargain of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel- but too far away”
Reviews.Author: Chalynne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Istanbul Marriott Hotel Asia for four nights. It is a beautiful hotel, with fabulous service, but it is too far away from the action if you are sightseeing in Istanbul. The cab ride to and from the international airport was appx $65/way. We took a taxi to the ferry boats, then the ferry to the Istanbul side for sightseeing, then reverse coming home. Our transportation cost were a minimum of $30/day. The food in the restaurant was terrible. We waited far too long for the food and then it tasted so bad, I sent it back. The chef insisted on making me a new meal, even though I just wanted it taken off the bill. Try to eat dinner before returning to the hotel, as there are very few places nearby to eat. The food in the executive lounge was very good and the executive lounge was great.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatrickG5
Reviews.Content: hotel is very new and very good. Rooms are very large.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelsuisse
Reviews.Content: As mentioned already before - luxury at it's best. Located on the Asian side - takes 10-15min by taxi to Bagdad Street. Rooms, breakfast, Service in Excecutive Lounge, Reception - fantastic. Always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its Best”
Reviews.Author: SKIND82
Reviews.Content: Stay at Marriott Istanbul was a magnificient experience. Facilities available at the Hotel are amazing like:- a) Gymnasium,SPA's,Indoor and Ourdoor Swimming Pool, Business Lounge etc. The staff is very polite and the sea view from the Business Lounge situated at the Top Floor is simply incredible. Multi-cuisine Restaurants cater to multi country foods and dining is a memorable experience. Rooms are very spacious and provide every comfort/luxury one expects. Next visit there is surely on cards for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Ameya_sw
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for about 10 days during my visit to Istanbul. A nice hotel comfortable cosy stay, good staff very helpful , though hotel not in the exact centre of city as any one would want to but was easy to commute with good taxi service

Reviews.Title: “Goof Business Hotel for visiting Factories on Asian side”
Reviews.Author: BinDereDoneDat
Reviews.Content: Stayed e nights whilst visiting factories on Asian side. This hotel is great for this as most industry is on teh Asian side, and if you stayed in Sultanahmet it would take a few hours to make it across in the morning! Hotel itself is quite upmarket and with priced accordingly - about â‚¬190 per night . On other hand much more basic hotel in Sultanahmt was â‚¬130 per night. Room was fine and deal gave free minibar and executive lounge which had finger food. There is quite a glitzy shopping centre a 10 minute taxi ride away - called teh Palladium - which is worth visiting - good as any in Europe. Even though 10 minutes away in taxi you could walk it in 5minutes except you'd never make it across the highways which are very busy. Porter took my luggage up and remembered my name when I met him next day - which is a good technique to teach staff. Elaborate fitness centre but looked as if you needed to be fit to use it. Outdoor and indoor swimming pool, but outdoor not being used as 'too cold' !! Would stay here agin if on business in Istanbul, but for tourist visit Sultanahmet is teh place.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: shiftman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott Asia and could not fault the hotel. The rooms are big and the bathroom well stocked. The bathrobes and slippers are a nice touch. Breakfast had a wide variety of choice with the chefs on hand to cook extras if required. We had one evening meal of two courses and drinks which cost 104tlr which I thought to be very resionable. The only down side is the distance to the harbour which cost about Â£11 each way. The ferry crossing was 1.5tlr about 75pence but the hotel and staff more than make up for that. They were always polite and very helpful. We only used the indoor pool, sauna and gym and could not fault the facilities. This is without doubt a 5 star hotel and I would happily recomend it as a base for a vist to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel to avoid the bridge”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerTom
Reviews.Content: The hotel has large rooms, with all amenities you may expect. Hotel is a bit expensive, but the only real alternative on the Asian side. The major draw for this hotel is therefore it is located at the Asian side of the bridge, so for business on the Asian side it is ok. For touristic adventures, the hotel is located in the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms, Restaurant, Bar, all Great !”
Reviews.Author: tripwitch
Reviews.Content: Only disadvantage of this hotel is being far from touristic and business centers of city, but when your done with your works outside, you won t need to leave hotel for dinner or a drink, they re all great inside. And rooms include everything you need, well decorated, clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - On the Asia side - Get an Exec Room 20th floor +”
Reviews.Author: BigMacUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now - great hotel - lots of really nice touches. Make sure you get an exec room - you'll probably get a good price on one. Lounge upstairs is good - Breakfast is amazing... Ironing board and internet in exec rooms.. quiet and comfortable - rooms are big - desks are comfortable.. stay here - you'll like it.... pack your trunks.... enjoy the backlava - they turn the hot food over to dsert at about 8pm ish...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: urbandivaLondon
Reviews.Content: Bought my partner for her birthday and had a lovely stay, they gave us a sea view on a high floor on request. Customer service was excellent, as was the room itself (spacious and well kitted) Breakfast was a vast array of choices. The only downside was location; you have to take a taxi to the ferry port, then a ferry to the tourist area. The ferry themselves are cheap and well worth the journey as an experience in itself. Would def recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: vastgotta
Reviews.Content: Normally I dont get too excited about staying at a big brand hotel.. This time though was different, better. LOCATION: The hotel location really needs to be alligned with the purpose of your trip. I dont think it would attract holiday makers as there is not much to see or do around (other then a shopping mall). Its about 45 minutes from the airport and with proper security around its building. CHECK IN: The Check in was very good. Very professional, address you by your name. Your documents have already been filled in and printed out prior to your stay. There was an advice for the Executive rooms to be a better financial deal for me: Including internet, breakfast and minibar for about 30 EUR per night. I took it and didnt regret it. ROOMS: I had a room somewhere 20+ floor. Great view at night. Windows from floor to wall. Bathroom had a bath only, no seperate shower (always a petty). Plenty of ammenities, like bathsalt etc. Really good. The mini bar was well stocked and all choices where included in my rate.. never felt that good drinking a beer from the bar. The executive lounge was also great. Good views, nice snacks which were different every night I stayed there. Breakfast was served there (as well as in the main breakfast room). It was simple but good in the lounge. Newspapers where available. SERVICE: Very good, people make an effort to address you by your name. The staff in the bar at the ground floor where efficient, friendly and spoke English really well. Although not the nicest Marriott I have ever stayed in, it is definitly the Marriott with the friendliest service.

HotelInfo.Name: Istanbul Marriott Hotel Asia
HotelInfo.Address: Kayisdagi cad. No 1/1 | Atasehir, Istanbul 34750, Turkey
